habitat_description: This species is found in isolated populations through various non-desert habitats from just above 1400m to almost 2200m in elevation.  It occupies heavily grazed areas, forests, woodlands, and dense chaparral in the Music and Mazatzal mountains and southeast of the Grand Canyon. In the south of the Grand Canyon it can be found in woodland composed of pinon, juniper and sagebrush flats. In the Mazatzal mountains it inhabits Scrub Oak, manzanita, and other shrubs. This species occurs in northern Arizona on the southwestern edge of the Colorado Plateau (Jones and Lovich 2009). Found in Plains and Great Basin Grassland, Interior Chaparral, Great Conifer Woodland, Petran Montane Conifer Forest, Coconino Plateau eastward onto the Navajo Reservation (Brennan and Holycross 2009; Wright and Lowe 1993).
